info.title: Notes API Documentation
info.description:
Welcome to the Notes API Documentation. 

This API allows you to manage notes and organize them according to different categories. 

## Features
- Create notes with title and content.
- Categorize notes into different categories.
- Update and delete notes.
- Search notes by title or category.

This API is also utilized as a backend for the [Notes App available here](https://practice.expandtesting.com/notes/app/).



## API Authorization Guide

To use this API, you must first have a valid account on the system and know your email and password. Once you have that information:

Log in to the API using the **login endpoint**. This will provide you with an authentication token that you can use to access the protected resources.

Keep the token safe, as you will need it for subsequent requests.

To authorize your requests, click the "**Authorize**" button on the top right corner of the Swagger UI interface. A dialog box will appear asking you to enter the authentication token.
Enter the token you obtained from the login endpoint and click "**Authorize**".

You are now authorized to use all the protected API endpoints.



If you need help using this API, check out our **video guide and demo**, which are available [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQYvS6EEBZc?sub_confirmation=1)

## Contact Information

If you have any questions or feedback, please do not hesitate to contact us via [email](mailto:expand.testing@gmail.com)

get.description: Returns the profile information for the logged-in current user.

patch.description: Update the user profile information for the logged-in user

post.summary: Send password reset link to user's email
post.description: Sends a password reset link to the user's email address, allowing them to reset their password

success.description: Indicates whether the password reset link was sent successfully

message.description: Success message indicating that the password reset link was sent successfully
message.example: Password reset link successfully sent to practice@expandtesting.com. Please verify by clicking on the given link

post.description: Verify that the provided password reset token

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The password reset token received via email

200.description: The provided password reset token is valid

success.description: Indicates whether the token is valid

message.description: Success message indicating that the token is valid
message.example: The provided password reset token is valid

post.description: Reset a user's password with a valid password reset token and a new password

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The password reset token received via email

parameters.name: newPassword
parameters.description: The new password for the user's account

success.description: Indicates whether the password reset was successful

message.description: Success message indicating that the password reset was successful
message.example: The password has been successfully reset

post.description: Change a user's password by providing the user's current password and the new password.

success.description: Indicates whether the password change was successful

message.description: Success message indicating that the password change was successful

delete.description: Log out the currently authenticated user by invalidating their token.

200.description: Successfully updated the note's completed status
